name: Bouvardia
description: Bouvardia is a genus of about 50 species of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae, native to Mexico and tropical America.These species are evergreen herbs or shrubs, with large, deep-green leaves and single or double trumpet-shaped or star-shaped flowers, carried on tall, sometimes woody stems. They attract birds and butterflies to the garden and make wonderful additions to a number of different kinds of bouquets and arrangements.

color_description: Bouvardia comes in shades of white, yellow, pink, orange and red.
